metadata.title: CVE-2019-3883 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In 389-ds-base up to version 1.4.1.2, requests are handled by workersthreads. Each sockets will be waited by the worker for at most'ioblocktimeout' seconds. However this timeout applies only forun-encrypted requests. Connections using SSL/TLS are not taking thistimeout into account during reads, and may hang longer.An unauthenticatedattacker could repeatedly create hanging LDAP requests to hang all theworkers, resulting in a Denial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.1.5-1
389-ds-base - 1.4.1.5-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.1.5-1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.1.5-1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.1.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.1.5-1').
